org.apache.flume.conf

Class LogPrivacyUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flume.conf.LogPrivacyUtil

  • public class LogPrivacyUtil
extends Object
    Utility class to help any Flume component determine whether logging potentially sensitive information is allowed or not.

    InterfaceAudience.Public
    InterfaceStability.Evolving

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String LOG_PRINTCONFIG_PROP
      system property name to enable logging of information related to the validation of agent configuration at startup.
      static String LOG_RAWDATA_PROP
      system property name to enable logging of potentially sensitive user data

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LogPrivacyUtil() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean allowLogPrintConfig()
      Tells whether logging of potentially sensitive user data is allowed or not.
      static boolean allowLogRawData()
      Tells whether logging of configuration details - including secrets - is allowed or not.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • LOG_RAWDATA_PROP

        public static final String LOG_RAWDATA_PROP
        system property name to enable logging of potentially sensitive user data
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOG_PRINTCONFIG_PROP

        public static final String LOG_PRINTCONFIG_PROP
        system property name to enable logging of information related to the validation of agent configuration at startup.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • LogPrivacyUtil

        public LogPrivacyUtil()

    • Method Detail

      • allowLogRawData

        public static boolean allowLogRawData()
        Tells whether logging of configuration details - including secrets - is allowed or not. This is driven by a system property defined by LOG_PRINTCONFIG_PROP
        Returns:
        true only if logging is allowed

      • allowLogPrintConfig

        public static boolean allowLogPrintConfig()
        Tells whether logging of potentially sensitive user data is allowed or not. This is driven by a system property defined by LOG_RAWDATA_PROP
        Returns:
        true only if logging is allowed
